title: >>> GIRLS Gone WILD
body_text:
It's fact that anytime you've got siblings, they will butt heads.
Liz, 21, and soon-to-be 20 years Kathryn debuted at events DAY 2 and DAY 3 respectively, but have not once met in any type of confrontation. Some one year and eight months later, the world will witness the implosion of the Nogueira family as one walks out of DODGEBALL 87 with their hand raised in victory while the other leaves utterly humiliated.
Did You Know?
1.
Liz won "Most Improved Player" at DODGEBALL X for her performance during the first-half of Season 1.
2.
Kathryn is a 2-time award winner. She's received the prestigious "Appreciation Award" at DODGEBALL 30 and is the first [and only] recipient of the "Ultimate Appreciation Award" (DODGEBALL 70) for her efforts behind the scenes.
3.
Liz has never won a captains match, with her only loss at DODGEBALL 21 to none other than Lauren Winston.
4.
Kathryn was the first captain
ever
to win via a shut-out. She did so at DODGEBALL LXIV against long-time friend Aimee Savoth.
Other
Family Feuds
DODGEBALL DAY 1: September 3, 2005
One has go all the back to the inaugural event to trace the history of the so-called
Family Feuds
. One Valerie Winston defeated her younger sister Lauren in the match that started it all.
DODGEBALL X: October 28, 2005
The charismatic Steve Adams beat youngest sibling Kevin in an unforgettable three-hour war. It was only a sign of things to come.
DODGEBALL XXVIII: February 25, 2006
The two eldest Adams share the spotlight when Chris defeats Steve in the second Adams-only events.
DODGEBALL 50: August 4, 2006
The brothers do it again, this time in the Summer of 2006. Then-Captains Champion Kevin Adams teamed with DODGEBALL X opponent Steve to face and later defeat the first-ever
Rimshot Contest
winners Tom and Chris Adams.
DODGEBALL 54: September 3, 2006
The rematch of the century at the One Year Anniversary ... Valerie made it 2 and 0 against Lauren in their return match from DODGEBALL DAY 1.
DODGEBALL SIXTY-IX: December 23, 2006
The desire for revenge finally prevailed when Lauren Winston took down Valerie in the first three-peat match in dodgeball history.
........
Still to come on
The Road to 90
... Butler vs. Edwards, Dan Spengeman Returns, and Justin Pierce vs. Tom Adams.
body_html:
It's fact that anytime you've got siblings, they will butt heads.

Liz, 21, and soon-to-be 20 years Kathryn debuted at events DAY 2 and DAY 3 respectively, but have not once met in any type of confrontation. Some one year and eight months later, the world will witness the implosion of the Nogueira family as one walks out of DODGEBALL 87 with their hand raised in victory while the other leaves utterly humiliated.

Did You Know?
1. Liz won "Most Improved Player" at DODGEBALL X for her performance during the first-half of Season 1.
2. Kathryn is a 2-time award winner. She's received the prestigious "Appreciation Award" at DODGEBALL 30 and is the first [and only] recipient of the "Ultimate Appreciation Award" (DODGEBALL 70) for her efforts behind the scenes.
3. Liz has never won a captains match, with her only loss at DODGEBALL 21 to none other than Lauren Winston.
4. Kathryn was the first captain ever to win via a shut-out. She did so at DODGEBALL LXIV against long-time friend Aimee Savoth.


Other Family Feuds
DODGEBALL DAY 1: September 3, 2005 One has go all the back to the inaugural event to trace the history of the so-called Family Feuds. One Valerie Winston defeated her younger sister Lauren in the match that started it all.

DODGEBALL X: October 28, 2005 The charismatic Steve Adams beat youngest sibling Kevin in an unforgettable three-hour war. It was only a sign of things to come.

DODGEBALL XXVIII: February 25, 2006 The two eldest Adams share the spotlight when Chris defeats Steve in the second Adams-only events.

DODGEBALL 50: August 4, 2006 The brothers do it again, this time in the Summer of 2006. Then-Captains Champion Kevin Adams teamed with DODGEBALL X opponent Steve to face and later defeat the first-ever Rimshot Contest winners Tom and Chris Adams.

DODGEBALL 54: September 3, 2006 The rematch of the century at the One Year Anniversary ... Valerie made it 2 and 0 against Lauren in their return match from DODGEBALL DAY 1.

DODGEBALL SIXTY-IX: December 23, 2006 The desire for revenge finally prevailed when Lauren Winston took down Valerie in the first three-peat match in dodgeball history.

........

Still to come on The Road to 90 ... Butler vs. Edwards, Dan Spengeman Returns, and Justin Pierce vs. Tom Adams.
